title: India to tighten remittance rules, bar offshore time deposits, sources say
Video shows ‘nothing working’ on Air India plane
Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Israel Conducts Preemptive Strike On Iran, Declares State Of Emergency
description: Israel launched a "preemptive strike" on Iran, the country's defence minister said early Friday, after US President Donald Trump had warned that Israel could soon strike Iran's nuclear sites.

title: North Korea Relaunches Damaged Destroyer: Report
description: A North Korean naval destroyer damaged in a botched launch last month has been relaunched, with leader Kim Jong Un presiding over the ceremony, South Korean news agency Yonhap reported early Friday, citing the North's state media.

title: Israel conducts airstrikes on Iran, Netanyahu says targeted nuclear program
description: Israel's defense minister announces 'special situation' after Israeli attack on Iran.

title: Air India crash: What to know about the first fatal Boeing Dreamliner tragedy
description: An Air India jet flying from Ahmedabad to London crashed shortly after takeoff into a fireball with 242 people aboard.

title: Air India plane crash claims at least 241 lives as one passenger survives
description: One British man, who was a passenger on the London-bound flight, survived the crash in Ahmedabad, western India.

title: British man is only passenger to survive India plane crash
description: Vishwashkumar Ramesh is only passenger to survive the Air India crash that killed 241 people.

title: Over 260 Dead After Air India Crash, Official Says, With One Survivor
description: The London-bound Boeing Dreamliner went down moments after takeoff in Ahmedabad, India. The airline confirmed that only one of the 242 people aboard survived. The victims included students at a medical college where the plane crashed.
author: The New York Times

title: Anti-Migrant Rioters in Northern Ireland Set Homes, and Then a Refuge Site, Ablaze
description: Rioters clashed with police in Ballymena, and masked groups set fire to a recreation center in Larne, where families had been given temporary shelter.
author: Ali Watkins

title: Watch: Senator Alex Padilla forcibly removed, handcuffed at Kristi Noem’s news conference; Democrats call it 'shameful abuse of power'
description: Democratic Senator Alex Padilla was forcibly removed and handcuffed during Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem's Los Angeles press conference, sparking national outrage. Padilla interrupted Noem to question immigration raids, leading to a confrontation where he was pushed to the ground. Democrats condemned the incident as an abuse of power, while Republicans defended Noem, accusing Padilla of inappropriate behavior.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Trump’s immigration shift? 'They've turned out to be great,' says US President on farm workers; watch video
description: US President Donald Trump hinted at a potential policy shift on immigration, suggesting some undocumented immigrants could stay to prevent labor shortages in agriculture and hospitality. An executive order is being considered to protect farm workers, many of whom lack legal status but have worked for years.
author: TOI World Desk

title: The idea was to crush his spirit’: family of jailed British-Egyptian man describe awful prison conditions
description: As Alaa Abd el-Fattah’s mother remains on hunger strike, supporters say activist’s continued detention is campaign of vengeance by Egypt’s presidentFamily, friends and supporters of the jailed British-Egyptian activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah have spoken about the conditions of his long imprisonment as his mother, Laila Soueif, remains in a London hospital in declining health on a hunger strike to secure his release.Amid a mounting campaign to put pressure on British ministers to intervene more forcefully on Abd el-Fattah’s behalf, supporters say his continued detention is part of a campaign of vengeance motivated by the personal animus of the Egyptian president, Abdel Fatah al-Sisi, towards him. Continue reading...
author: Peter Beaumont and Mahmoud Ahmad

title: 250 days on hunger strike: Can Laila Soueif secure her son’s freedom? – podcast
description: Who is Alaa Abd el-Fattah and why are British diplomats trying to obtain his release? Patrick Wintour reportsLaila Soueif, 69, has been on hunger strike in London for more than 250 days in an effort to secure the release of her son, the activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah, from jail in Egypt. As diplomatic pressure mounts, she is now in a critical condition.Alaa’s sister Mona Seif describes to Michael Safi the toll that imprisonment has taken on her brother, her mother’s determination to do whatever she can to secure his release, and the difficulty of coming to terms with her mother’s decision to risk her life. Continue reading...
author: Presented by Michael Safi with Patrick Wintour; produced by Natalie Ktena, Ivor Manley and Joel Cox; executive producer Courtney Yusuf

title: Israelis gather in a shelter following sirens in Tel Aviv early Friday.
author: Washington Post staff

title: Live updates: Israel launches ‘preemptive strike’ on Iran’s nuclear program
description: Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz said Israel had launched a “preemptive strike” against Iran and declared a “special emergency situation” in case of retaliation.
author: Lior Soroka, Rachel Pannett
